Tests (not just unit tests, all tests) should go as fast as possible.  =
The

egular basis or, ideally, every time before they commit something.

 first thing I do is appy
the principle "Don't Repeat Yourself".  Not in te=
rms of code, but of
runtime.  If something only needs to be run once, I mak=
e sure it only gets
run once.  Having as much control as possible on this w=
as of paramount
importance to me, which is why TestNG extends JUnit's setUp=
/tearDown
principle to work around test classes, test suites and even test =
groups.
This gives you maximal control on the granularity of your setUp/tea=
rDown
cycle.

y

ructor so that those

ent

 for

In JUnit, you have fou=
r ways to initialize / tear down your test, and they

I find that confusing a=
